entry.tran: 贸易站；前哨基地；（设在国外的）军事基地
entry.def: An outpost is a small group of buildings used for trading or military purposes, either in a distant part of your own country or in a foreign country.

example.ex: ...a remote mountain outpost, linked to the outside world by the poorest of roads.
example.tran: 靠一条崎岖艰险的山路与外界相连的偏远山区哨站

means.word_mean: 1. a station in a remote or sparsely populated location
2. a settlement on the frontier of civilization
3. a military post stationed at a distance from the main body of troops
